protocol_name: Fasciola spp. faecal sedimentation protocol for concentration of eggs and DNA isolation
protocol_name_html: Fasciola spp. faecal sedimentation protocol for concentration of eggs and DNA isolation
manuscript_citation: Calvani NED, Windsor PA, Bush RD, Šlapeta J (2017) Scrambled eggs: A highly sensitive molecular diagnostic workflow for Fasciola species specific detection from faecal samples. PLoS Negl Trop Dis 11(9): e0005931. doi: 10.1371/journal.pntd.0005931
keywords: Fasciola, sedimentation, DNA isolation, molecular diagnostics, zoonosis

components.data: Mix faecal samples (3 g and 6 g for sheep and cattle, respectively) with distilled water to form a homogenous solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix faecal samples (3 g and 6 g for sheep and cattle, respectively) with distilled water to form a homogenous solution.

components.data: Traditional sedimentation for Fasciola spp.
components.name: Section

components.data: Hose the solution through a 270 µm nylon sieve into a 250 ml conical measuring cylinder, top with distilled water and allow to sediment for three minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Hose the solution through a 270 µm nylon sieve into a 250 ml conical measuring cylinder, top with distilled water and allow to sediment for three minutes.

components.data: Traditional sedimentation for Fasciola spp.
components.name: Section

components.data: After three minutes aspirate the supernatant and pour the sediment into a 100 ml conical measuring cylinder, rinse the 250 ml conical cylinder into the new cylinder and top with distilled water. Allow to sediment for a further three minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After three minutes aspirate the supernatant and pour the sediment into a 100 ml conical measuring cylinder, rinse the 250 ml conical cylinder into the new cylinder and top with distilled water. Allow to sediment for a further three minutes.

components.data: Traditional sedimentation for Fasciola spp.
components.name: Section

components.data: Aspirate the supernatant and pour the remaining sediment into a 15 ml centrifuge tube, rinse the 100 ml conical cylinder into the 15 ml centrifuge tube and top with distilled water. Allow to sediment for a final three minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate the supernatant and pour the remaining sediment into a 15 ml centrifuge tube, rinse the 100 ml conical cylinder into the 15 ml centrifuge tube and top with distilled water. Allow to sediment for a final three minutes.

components.data: Traditional sedimentation for Fasciola spp.
components.name: Section

components.data: Traditional sedimentation for Fasciola spp.
components.name: Section

components.data: Aspirate the supernatant, leaving 2 ml of sediment. To perform a faecal egg count proceed to step 6. To go straight to DNA isolation proceed to step 9.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Aspirate the supernatant, leaving 2 ml of sediment. To perform a faecal egg count proceed to step 6. To go straight to DNA isolation proceed to step 9.

components.data: All yellow-brown Fascola eggs should be counted. Counts should be divided by 2 to calculate eggs per gram (EPG) for cattle. EPGs for sheep are as observed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: All yellow-brown Fascola eggs should be counted. Counts should be divided by 2 to calculate eggs per gram (EPG) for cattle. EPGs for sheep are as observed.

components.data: Faecal egg count (FEC) for EPG calculation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Faecal egg count (FEC) for EPG calculation

components.data: Concentration for disruption and DNA isolation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Concentration for disruption and DNA isolation

components.data:
If samples were used to calculate EPG: Return individual samples to the 15 ml centrifuge tubes and centrifuged at 2500 g for 10 minutes to form a pellet.

 

If proceeding straight from step 5: Centrifuge samples at 2500 g for 10 minutes to form a pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
If samples were used to calculate EPG: Return individual samples to the 15 ml centrifuge tubes and centrifuged at 2500 g for 10 minutes to form a pellet.

 

If proceeding straight from step 5: Centrifuge samples at 2500 g for 10 minutes to form a pellet.

components.data: Manually remove the entire pellet from the 15 ml centrifuge tube using a combination of Pasteur pipettes and fine wooden applicator sticks and place into a pre-prepared bead-beating tube containing ceramic beads and lysis buffer (BioLine Isolate Fecal DNA Kit).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Manually remove the entire pellet from the 15 ml centrifuge tube using a combination of Pasteur pipettes and fine wooden applicator sticks and place into a pre-prepared bead-beating tube containing ceramic beads and lysis buffer (BioLine Isolate Fecal DNA Kit).

components.data: Concentration for disruption and DNA isolation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Concentration for disruption and DNA isolation

components.data: Disrupt the samples at 6.0 m/s for 40 seconds on a bench top homogeniser (FastPrep®-24 MP Biomedicals, Australia). Place on ice after disruption until continuing with DNA isolation (BioLine Isolate Fecal DNA Kit) and amplification.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Disrupt the samples at 6.0 m/s for 40 seconds on a bench top homogeniser (FastPrep®-24 MP Biomedicals, Australia). Place on ice after disruption until continuing with DNA isolation (BioLine Isolate Fecal DNA Kit) and amplification.

components.data: Concentration for disruption and DNA isolation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Concentration for disruption and DNA isolation

components.data: To examine the sediment for fluke eggs, add 2 drops of methylene blue (1%), shake to mix and rinse into a 6.5×17×1 cm grid perspex tray. Additional distilled water can be added to allow for ease of counting. Examine under a stereomicroscope at 15× magnification.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To examine the sediment for fluke eggs, add 2 drops of methylene blue (1%), shake to mix and rinse into a 6.5×17×1 cm grid perspex tray. Additional distilled water can be added to allow for ease of counting. Examine under a stereomicroscope at 15× magnification.
